item.title: I finally made it - I became a Billionnaire
Law of Jante - Jantelagen in swedish
item.description:
Jante’s law is a set of ten rules, very common in Scandinavia:

  1. You’re not to think you are anything special.
  2. You’re not to think you are as good as we are.
  3. You’re not to think you are smarter than we are.
  4. You’re not to convince yourself that you are better than we are.
  5. You’re not to think you know more than we do.
  6. You’re not to think you are more important than we are.
  7. You’re not to think you are good at anything.
  8. You’re not to laugh at us.
  9. You’re not to think anyone cares about you.
  10. You’re not to think you can teach us anything.

Read more on Wikipedia

item.title: Guy Goma predicted Spotify 10 years ago!
item.description:
It’s 10 years since Guy Goma became a celebrity after he was mistaken for an internet expert and interviewed on BBC News TV. The unemployed computer technician had been at the BBC for a job interview. But the graduate from the Congo gained worldwide attention after a mix-up saw him interviewed on air instead of Guy Kewney

Guy Goma on Wikipedia

It’s 10 years since Guy Goma became a celebrity after he was mistaken for an internet expert and interviewed on BBC News TV. The unemployed computer technician had been at the BBC for a job interview. But the graduate from the Congo gained worldwide attention after a mix-up saw him interviewed on air instead of Guy Kewney

item.title: Google links turn black experiment
item.description:
Today Google links just turned black, i guess this is some kind of A/B testing. The experiment is taking place in some part of the world, in Netherland the links are black, however in Morocco they’re still blue.

This post on Reddit discuss this subject further.

Link to Reddit post

Today Google links just turned black, i guess this is some kind of A/B testing. The experiment is taking place in some part of the world, in Netherland the links are black, however in Morocco they’re still blue.

item.title: 30 days of genius with Arianna Huffington
item.description:
30 Days of Genius is free video series hosted by Chase Jarvis, a renowned photographer and CreativeLive Founder. Chris interviews 30 of the brightest creative and entrepreneurial minds of our time.

Today’s guest is Arianna Huffington, she mentioned the importance of getting a solid night’s sleep.

You are not your job., a quote on the ability to distinguish yourself from your job, if you do so, you become less able to take risks and to be detached from periodic stress. To be successful, you have to be fearless, bold and creative.

Link to Creativelive
30 Days of Genius is free video series hosted by Chase Jarvis, a renowned photographer and CreativeLive Founder. Chris interviews 30 of the brightest creative and entrepreneurial minds of our time.

item.title: Scaling Agile at Spotify
item.description:
The way Spotify scales its Agile methodology is using a Matrix that includes “Tribes, Squads, Chapters & Guilds”.

This document highlight how Spotify (a disruptive Unicorn Swedish startup) deals with it multiple teams and thousands of members.

Link to download the PDF
The way Spotify scales its Agile methodology is using a Matrix that includes “Tribes, Squads, Chapters & Guilds”.

item.title: Books i read in 2015
item.description:
2015 was awesome, i invested on thy self & i came back to reading books, below are the books i read:

Goodreads is a great way to keep track of the books you’ve read, my motivation for blogging about books i read is Derek Sivers, Books finished recently.

Life

Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less - Greg McKeown

The Antidote: Happiness for People Who Can’t Stand Positive Thinking - Oliver Burkeman

Crucial Conversations: Tools for Talking When Stakes Are High - Kerry Patterson

Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future - Ashlee Vance

Steve Jobs - Walter Isaacson

Startup

The Lean Startup: How Today’s Entrepreneurs Use Continuous Innovation to Create Radically Successful Businesses - Eric ries

The Hard Thing About Hard Things: Building a Business When There Are No Easy Answers - Ben Horowitz

Inspired: How To Create Products Customers Love - Marty Cagan

Getting Real: The Smarter, Faster, Easier Way to Build a Web Application - Jason Fried & David Heinemeier Hansson

Lean UX: Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience - Jeff Gothelf

Running Lean: Iterate from Plan A to a Plan That Works - Ash Maurya

How Google Works - Eric Schmidt

The $100 Startup: Reinvent the Way You Make a Living, Do What You Love, and Create a New Future - Chris Guillebeau

The Startup Owner’s Manual: The Step-By-Step Guide for Building a Great Company - Steven Blank

The Founder’s Dilemmas: Anticipating and Avoiding the Pitfalls That Can Sink a Startup - Noam Wasserman

Product

Lean from the Trenches Managing Large-Scale Projects with Kanban - Henrik Kniberg

Growth Hacker Marketing: A Primer on the Future of PR, Marketing, and Advertising - Ryan Holiday

Growth Hacker Marketing: A Primer on the Future of PR, Marketing, and Advertising - Ryan Holiday

The Phoenix Project Gene Kim, George Spafford, and Kevin Behr

Currently reading in 2016

Lean Analytics: Use Data to Build a Better Startup Faster - Alistair, Croll

Speak Like Churchill, Stand Like Lincoln: 21 Powerful Secrets of History’s Greatest Speakers - James C Humes

Purple Cow: Transform Your Business by Being Remarkable - Seth Godin
2015 was awesome, i invested on thy self & i came back to reading books, below are the books i read:

item.title: Lesson on perseverence and resilience Meru
item.description:
A great lesson on perseverence and resilience can be learned from the extreme sport documentary “Meru”, back in 2008, three elite climbers Conrad Anker, Jimmy Chin and Renan Ozturk attempted their first ascent of the precarious Shark’s Fin route on Mount Meru, in the Indian Himalayas, due to the high risk of losing fingers and toes, if not their lives, the team decided to give up just a few hundred feet from the summit.

In 2011, they went back to the Shark’s Fin on Mount Meru for a new attempt, this time with some important lessons learned, they made it.

A great lesson on perseverence and resilience can be learned from the extreme sport documentary “Meru”, back in 2008, three elite climbers Conrad Anker, Jimmy Chin and Renan Ozturk attempted their first ascent of the precarious Shark’s Fin route on Mount Meru, in the Indian Himalayas, due to the high risk of losing fingers and toes, if not their lives, the team decided to give up just a few hundred feet from the summit.

item.title: Positive thinking - How to Become a Positive Broadcaster with Michelle Gielan
item.description:
The last episode of the unmistakable creative is quite interesting, discussing Positive thinking, i used to complain quite a lot (and i still do sometimes), but i’ve been improving over the last year.

Michelle Gielan, is happiness researcher and former CBS news anchor, she authored the book Broadcasting Happiness: The Science of Igniting and Sustaining Positive Change

Some points Michelle discuss:

  • Finding a way or making one with our challenges
  • The power of how we start conversations
  • 7 Strategies for being more influential in a positive way
  • Using the power of positive habits to alleviate depression
  • Dealing with the negative people in our lives

Unmistakable creative link

The last episode of the unmistakable creative is quite interesting, discussing Positive thinking, i used to complain quite a lot (and i still do sometimes), but i’ve been improving over the last year.

item.title: Seth Godin startup school 2012
item.description:
Recently i had the pleasure to listen to Seth Godin recording where he guides thirty entrepreneurs through a workshop exploring how they can build and run their dream business.

This podcast is a great source of inspiration, here is Seth’s welcome message:

In the summer of 2012, I had an amazing opportunity to spend three days with a group of extremely motivated entrepreneurs. People right at the beginning of building their project, launching their organization. During those three days, I took them on a guided tour of some of the questions they were going to have to wrestle with, some of the difficult places they were going to strand up and say “this is me, this is what I’m making”.

There you go, the links:

Itunes

Soundcloud

And a summary too:

25 insights from Seth Godin’s startup school
Recently i had the pleasure to listen to Seth Godin recording where he guides thirty entrepreneurs through a workshop exploring how they can build and run their dream business.
